summary: E-commerce app named Solano7m being built for the user.

existing_features.title: Build a product catalog page that displays all available products in a responsive grid, with each product card showing image, name, price, and an 'Add to Cart' button. Include category filtering and a search bar.
Build a product detail page that shows full product information (name, description, price, image, stock), allows quantity selection, and provides an 'Add to Cart' button.
Build a shopping cart page that lists all cart items with quantity controls (increment/decrement/remove), displays line-item totals and a grand total, and includes a 'Proceed to Checkout' button.
Build a checkout page that shows an order summary and a 'Place Order' button. On confirmation, the order is submitted to the backend and the user is shown a success screen with the order ID.
Build an order history page where authenticated users can view their past orders, including order date, items, total, and status.

Apply a bold, modern retail visual theme across the entire app using a warm earthy palette (deep terracotta, cream, and charcoal), clean sans-serif typography, generous whitespace, and consistent card-based layouts with smooth hover interactions.
Render the generated hero banner image and logo as static assets in the app header and catalog hero section from frontend/public/assets/generated.

Build an Admin Panel page at /admin accessible only to authenticated users with the admin role. The page must include: a product list table showing all products (name, category, price, stock), an 'Add Product' form (name, description, price, category, stock quantity, image URL), an 'Edit Product' form pre-populated with existing product data, and a 'Delete Product' button with confirmation. Non-admin users who visit /admin should see an access-denied message.
Add an 'Admin' navigation link in the app header (Layout.tsx) that is visible only when the authenticated user has the admin role, linking to /admin.

new_feature_requests.summary: E-commerce app with product listings, cart, and checkout

Create a backend actor that stores and manages product listings (id, name, description, price, image URL, category, stock quantity), supports CRUD operations for products, and persists data across upgrades.
Implement a shopping cart on the backend that allows adding, updating quantity, and removing items per user (keyed by principal), and returns the cart contents with totals.
Implement an order system on the backend where a user can place an order from their current cart, storing order history (order id, items, total, timestamp, status) per user.
Add an admin panel for product management (add/edit/delete products with name, description, price, category, stock, image URL) accessible only to authorized admin users.

Add a backend function to register or designate a specific principal as an admin. Ensure the existing role-based access control (admin/user) in the backend actor is used to gate all product CRUD operations so only admin principals can add, edit, or delete products.
